Package org.javact.lang

Interface Summary
Actor Marking (empty) interface.
Agent  
BecomeCtI *META-COMPONENT-LEVEL* Specification of a Become component.
CreateCtI *META-COMPONENT-LEVEL* Specification of a Create component.
HookInterface Specification of objects used for actor's behavior resuming when mobility fails.
JavActComponentInt Specification of the common features of actors' components.
LifeCycleCtI *META-COMPONENT-LEVEL* Specification of a LifeCycle component.
MailBoxCtI *META-COMPONENT-LEVEL* Specification of a MailBox component.
Message Marking interface for messages (empty).
MoveCtI *META-COMPONENT-LEVEL* Specification of a Move component.
SendCtI *META-COMPONENT-LEVEL* Specification of a Send component.
ServerSideAnswerBack Specification of server-side objects in charge of returning a result to a client, in case of client-server-like interaction (MessageWithReply).
 

Class Summary
BecomeCt *META-COMPONENT-LEVEL* The standard Become component
Controler The controler of an actor.
Forwarder *META-COMPONENT-LEVEL* Forwarder object, which replaces actor's mailbox in case of mobility.
Future Defines partially a Future object, for client-server-like interaction.
FutureInitializer *META-COMPONENT-LEVEL* For initialization of Futures.
JavActComponent JavActComponent contains the code needed to access to the controler from within each component, and offers a default method to terminate itself.
LifeCycleCt *META-COMPONENT-LEVEL* The standard LifeCycle component.
MailBoxCt *META-COMPONENT-LEVEL* The standard MailBox component.
MessageWithReply Message for client-server-like interaction.
QuasiBehavior Actors' primary behavior, with the standard available methods.
 

Exception Summary
BecomeException A BecomeException is thrown when a RuntimeException occurs while an actor is changing behavior.
CreateException A CreateException is thrown when a RuntimeException occurs while an actor creation is requested.
GoException A GoException is thrown when a RuntimeException occurs when an actor moves.
JavActException JavAct run-time exception, superclass for all library-level exceptions which can be thrown to the application level
JSMSendException  
MessageHandleException Exception in the message handling step.
SendException A SendException is thrown when a RuntimeException occurs when a send fails.
